<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 805, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 212, 601]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 918, 104]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 442, 918, 474]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 487, 918, 519]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 165, 567, 181]]<|/det|>

Justify your answer by referring to values from the results. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 748, 866, 764]]<|/det|> [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 72, 136, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 72, 184, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 918, 104]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average cooling rate \(x_{1}\) during the first half of the experiment for the water in beaker B. Use the readings for beaker B from Table 2.1 and the equation:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 115, 556, 146]]<|/det|>
\[
x_{1}=\frac{\theta_{0}-\theta_{90}}{T},
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 158, 918, 191]]<|/det|>
where \(T=90s\) and \(\theta_{0}\) and \(\theta_{90}\) are the temperatures of the water in beaker B at times \(t=0\) and \(t=90s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 204, 329, 220]]<|/det|>
Include the unit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[548, 267, 885, 283]]<|/det|>
<form>x_{1}= .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 297, 184, 313]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 297, 918, 330]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average cooling rate \(x_{2}\) during the second half of the experiment for the water in beaker B. Use the readings for beaker B from Table 2.1 and the equation:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 340, 564, 371]]<|/det|>
\[
x_{2}=\frac{\theta_{90}-\theta_{180}}{T},
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 384, 920, 416]]<|/det|>
where \(T=90s\) and \(\theta_{90}\) and \(\theta_{180}\) are the temperatures of the water in beaker B at \(t=90s\) and \(t=180s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 429, 329, 445]]<|/det|>
Include the unit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[548, 492, 885, 508]]<|/det|>
<form>x_{2}= .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 522, 136, 538]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 522, 918, 554]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 92, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 501, 89]]<|/det|> A student investigates the resistance of a wire. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 104, 918, 136]]<|/det|> Plan an experiment which enables him to investigate how the length of a wire affects the resistance of the wire. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 143, 552, 170]]<|/det|> Resistance \(R\) is calculated from the equation: \(R=\frac{V}{I}\) ． <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 180, 834, 197]]<|/det|> where \(V\) is the potential difference (p.d.) across the wire and \(I\) is the current in the wire. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 212, 400, 228]]<|/det|> The apparatus available includes: <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 243, 330, 258]]<|/det|> · a selection of wires <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 260, 355, 274]]<|/det|> · a variable power supply <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 277, 260, 290]]<|/det|> · an ammeter <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 293, 256, 306]]<|/det|> · a voltmeter. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 322, 224, 337]]<|/det|> In your plan: <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 351, 460, 367]]<|/det|> · list any additional apparatus needed <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 382, 917, 414]]<|/det|> · complete Fig. 4.1 to show a voltmeter connected to measure the potential difference across the wire <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 429, 917, 461]]<|/det|> · explain briefly how to do the experiment, including the measurements to take so that the resistance can be determined <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 476, 485, 491]]<|/det|> ·
